|  [inverse(matrix, result)](./toygl.matrix4.inverse.md) | <code>static</code> | Computes the inverse of the provided matrix using Cramers Rule. If the determinant is zero, the matrix can not be inverted, and an exception is thrown. |
|  [multiply(left, right, result)](./toygl.matrix4.multiply.md) | <code>static</code> | Computes the product of two matrices. |
|  [multiplyByPoint(matrix, cartesian, result)](./toygl.matrix4.multiplybypoint.md) | <code>static</code> | Computes the product of a matrix and a [Cartesian3](./toygl.cartesian3.md)<!-- -->. This is equivalent to calling [Matrix4.multiplyByVector()](./toygl.matrix4.multiplybyvector.md) with a [Cartesian4](./toygl.cartesian4.md) with a <code>w</code> component of 1, but returns a [Cartesian3](./toygl.cartesian3.md) instead of a [Cartesian4](./toygl.cartesian4.md)<!-- -->. |
|  [multiplyByVector(matrix, cartesian, result)](./toygl.matrix4.multiplybyvector.md) | <code>static</code> | Computes the product of a matrix and a column vector. |
